data.overallSummary: John Doe shows stable vital signs and no current symptoms of asthma attack. Regular monitoring is important to maintain health.

healthAlerts.message: No symptoms of asthma attack detected at this time.

vitalsSummary: Blood pressure is consistently normal at 120/80 mmHg.
Heart rate remains steady at 70 bpm.
Blood sugar levels are within normal range at 100 mg/dL.
dailyPatterns: Regular meals observed; last meal was breakfast at 10:00 AM.
No unusual activities reported that affect health.
Vital signs stable throughout recent measurements.
smartAdvices: Continue regular monitoring of breathing and symptoms.
Maintain a healthy diet and routine physical activity.
Avoid exposure to asthma triggers such as smoke or allergens.
Stay hydrated and get adequate rest every day.
nextSteps: Keep tracking symptoms and vitals daily to catch any changes early.
Consult healthcare provider if any asthma symptoms like coughing or difficulty breathing develop.
Follow up with regular health check-ups for asthma management.
Ensure access to rescue inhaler if prescribed by a healthcare professional.
